Posted By: ElbowWarrior (12/4/2009 4:31:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Flameblast dragon and quietus spike would be devastating, either instant kill target blocker, or ping your opponent for 1 damage and it still takes off half their life points. If that x cost is big it reduces their life points and applies the damage, probably ending the game right away. It's all risky vs. removal, but if it works its almost a definite win. What's really great about flameblast dragon also is that even played normally, it's a great sneak attack card, as you can be losing and be down to 5 life, attack once and drop a huge x cost flameblast to your opponents life points and a lightning bolt for the win. Red also pairs with green in a lot of decks and green produces a lot of mana to throw at that x cost. You have to love that it says target player or creature as well, because then you can choose to kill off a planeswalker.
posts.html:

What's really great about flameblast dragon also is that even played normally, it's a great sneak attack card, as you can be losing and be down to 5 life, attack once and drop a huge x cost flameblast to your opponents life points and a lightning bolt for the win. Red also pairs with green in a lot of decks and green produces a lot of mana to throw at that x cost. You have to love that it says target player or creature as well, because then you can choose to kill off a planeswalker.

posts.post_content: Dragons seem overpowered these days.. I have one of these in a naya type deck and I can't switch it out for anything else because it wins way to many games, you can either lock down your enemy by using the flame blasts on their creatures once a turn, or can simply spam it on their life points when they get low enough. Probably the best of the jund dragons followed by broodmother.
